body_html:
The values of the pdf can be arbitrarily large but never negative. This is completely acceptable, and I am sure this is not a bug.

Simple example: normal distribution with standard deviation = 0.000001 and mean = 0. The pdf at x = 0 is 1000 / (2 * pi), and the natural log of this is clearly greater than 0.
body_text:
The values of the pdf can be arbitrarily large but never negative. This is completely acceptable, and I am sure this is not a bug.
Simple example: normal distribution with standard deviation = 0.000001 and mean = 0. The pdf at x = 0 is 1000 / (2 * pi), and the natural log of this is clearly greater than 0.
body:
The values of the `pdf` can be arbitrarily large but never negative. This is completely acceptable, and I am sure this is not a bug.

Simple example: normal distribution with standard deviation = 0.000001 and mean = 0. The `pdf` at `x = 0` is `1000 / (2 * pi)`, and the natural log of this is clearly greater than 0.
